--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "petar_chervenski" <petar_chervenski@...> 
wro=
te:
>
> > should I modify it so that a lower time yields a higher value for=
 
> fitness, for
> > example 1/(elapsed_time) ?
> 
> Yes.
>

Peter is right=
 that you need higher fitness values to mean better in 
NEAT.  The reason i=
s that fitness sharing equations are based on the 
assumption that higher i=
s better.  Without that, fitness sharing will 
malfunction.  For the same r=
eason, you should avoid fitness values of 
exactly zero or below.

You do n=
ot necessarily have to use 1/x as the formula, although that 
is one option=
.  You can also use MAX_FITNESS-performance+0.001.

The little fraction at =
the end is to ensure you don't get zero scores.

ken
